meanings.definition: To spread or smooth (a substance) by drawing a tool over it.
meanings.sent1: She strickled the icing on the cake to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter strickled the wood to create a polished finish.
meanings.sent3: The artist strickled paint on the canvas with precision and care.
meanings.sent4: The gardener strickled the soil, turning it into a perfect bed for the seeds.
meanings.sent5: The chef strickled the sauce on the dish, adding a final touch of flavor.

meanings.definition: To pour (a liquid) slowly and evenly over a surface.
meanings.sent1: He strickled the syrup on the pancakes, making sure it covered every inch.
meanings.sent2: The bartender strickled the cocktail ingredients into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The rain strickled down the window, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall strickled over the rocks, creating a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: She strickled the oil on the salad, ensuring an even distribution of flavor.
